decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by denying resources and disrupting your opponent's strategy. This is achieved through a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. The deck also includes powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage. By using cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt your opponent's mana base, while deploying threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters, you can dictate the pace of the game and secure victory through attrition.

The deck is focused on using artifact creatures and lands to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing cards like Wasteland, Null Rod, and Thorn of Amethyst to slow them down. Crucible of Worlds and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim provide additional value and card advantage. The deck also includes powerful artifacts like Moxen and Sol Ring to accelerate mana production. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence, disrupt the opponent's plans, and close out the game with powerful threats.

This Doomsday combo deck aims to quickly assemble the pieces needed to win the game in a single turn. By utilizing powerful card draw spells like Ponder, Ancestral Recall, and Dig Through Time alongside disruption like Force of Will and Duress, the deck can set up a winning line of play using Doomsday to stack the perfect cards on top of the library. Thassa's Oracle serves as the win condition, ensuring victory once Doomsday resolves. The deck is focused on efficiently executing this game-winning combo while protecting itself from opposing strategies.

This deck relies on a powerful combo involving Hermit Druid and Thassa's Oracle to win the game quickly. It also includes cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm for protection, along with cards to help find the combo pieces quickly like Brainstorm and Ponder. The overall strategy of the deck is to assemble the combo pieces as quickly as possible and protect them from disruption long enough to win the game.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the pace of the game. By including cards like Collector Ouphe and Deathrite Shaman to disrupt opponents' strategies while applying pressure with creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog, this deck aims to maintain board presence and tempo advantage. The inclusion of powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Force of Will allows for efficient card advantage and protection against opposing threats. By leveraging its diverse card pool, this BUG Midrange deck aims to adapt to various matchups effectively.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. The use of powerful mana acceleration in the form of Black Lotus and Moxen allows for casting multiple spells in a turn, while the inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing the player to replay low-cost permanents from the graveyard.

This aggro MUD deck focuses on using Mishra's Workshop to accelerate out powerful artifact threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Stonecoil Serpent while also disrupting opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Nettlecyst. With a mix of mana acceleration, disruptive elements like Null Rod and Sphere of Resistance, and versatile cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and deny them resources through land destruction with cards like Strip Mine and Ghost Quarter. The goal is to quickly establish board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping powerful artifacts onto the battlefield and using them to apply heavy pressure on the opponent. By utilizing Moxen and other mana acceleration cards, the deck aims to play game-changing threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Chalice of the Void and Nettlecyst helps control the opponent's spells, while cards like Grim Monolith and The One Ring provide additional mana resources. The deck also features key components like Time Vault and Manifold Key for potentially game-winning combos.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Paradoxical Outcome deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and card draw to generate mana and draw cards quickly, enabling the player to assemble a powerful win condition. With a mix of fast mana rocks like Mox Opal, powerful draw spells like Timetwister and Vampiric Tutor, and combo pieces like Time Vault and Paradoxical Outcome, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient plays and explosive turns. The inclusion of cards like Force of Will and Pyroblast provide protection and disruption to ensure the deck can execute its game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on using a combination of control spells, card advantage, and disruption to outlast opponents while efficiently using resources. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells, while generating incremental advantage through card draw and graveyard manipulation. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for card recursion and flexibility in game plans. Overall, the deck excels at controlling the game tempo and outmaneuvering opponents with strategic decision-making and resource management.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing hatebear creatures and disruptive spells to slow down opponents while still maintaining an aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to disrupt opponents' game plans, alongside creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter to pressure opponents, the deck aims to control the game tempo and secure victory. Additionally, cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Dauntless Dismantler provide extra utility and disruption options, making it difficult for opponents to establish their own game plan effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Underworld Breach combo to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard. The deck includes a variety of fast mana artifacts and card draw spells to quickly assemble the combo pieces. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around leveraging the graveyard and efficient spell casting to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo pieces needed to execute the Doomsday win condition efficiently and quickly. It includes powerful card draw and selection spells to find key cards like Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle, along with disruption in the form of counterspells and hand disruption. The goal is to use cards like Dark Ritual and Doomsday to set up a winning pile that will win the game on the spot when executed. The deck is designed to win the game in a single turn, often catching opponents off guard and securing victory.

The deck focuses on using the powerful Doomsday card to assemble a winning combination of cards quickly, typically utilizing card draw spells such as Ponder and Preordain to set up the perfect Doomsday pile. With a mix of fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Dark Ritual, along with disruption like Force of Will and Duress, the deck aims to efficiently and effectively win the game through a well-executed combo sequence involving Thassa's Oracle for a game-ending victory.

The deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana with cards like Mana Crypt, Moxen, and Mishra's Workshop, while using cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tinker to draw and tutor for combo pieces. The key combo involves using Time Vault and cards like Manifold Key or Voltaic Key to take extra turns. Karn, the Great Creator can also be used to tutor for key artifacts and shut down opponents' artifacts. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful win condition.

The deck focuses on a powerful combo strategy revolving around the card Paradoxical Outcome. By utilizing powerful mana rocks such as Black Lotus and Mishra's Workshop, along with key cards like Time Vault and Tinker, the deck aims to create explosive turns where multiple artifacts are cast and then bounced back to hand with Paradoxical Outcome to draw a large number of cards. This allows the player to find and assemble win conditions quickly, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and overwhelming card advantage.
